net.cloud.gfx.sprites

Class SimpleSpriteCollection

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.cloud.gfx.sprites.SpriteCollection
      • net.cloud.gfx.sprites.SimpleSpriteCollection

  • public class SimpleSpriteCollection
extends SpriteCollection
    A SpriteCollection which leaves abstract class behavior as default. The lock and unlock methods will do nothing, each sprite is treated as independent and synchronization is not considered an issue for a simple collection.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      SimpleSpriteCollection(int size)
      Create a collection of sprites where they are treated independently using the behavior found in SpriteCollection

    • Method Summary

      Double dispatch method.

      Does nothing.
      void unlock(int spriteIndex)
      Does nothing.

    • Constructor Detail

      • SimpleSpriteCollection

        public SimpleSpriteCollection(int size)
        Create a collection of sprites where they are treated independently using the behavior found in SpriteCollection
        Parameters:
        size - The number of sprites in the collection

    • Method Detail

      • lock

        public void lock(int spriteIndex)
        Does nothing. This collection does not treat synchronization as important and so this method will return immediately.
        Specified by:
        lock in class SpriteCollection
        Parameters:
        spriteIndex - The index of the sprite that will be modified

      • unlock

        public void unlock(int spriteIndex)
        Does nothing. Since you cannot acquire a lock, you cannot unlock.
        Specified by:
        unlock in class SpriteCollection
        Parameters:
        spriteIndex - The index of the sprite that is done being modified

      • finishLoading

        public java.awt.image.BufferedImage finishLoading(SpriteLoader loader,
                                                  SpriteSet set,
                                                  int spriteID,
                                                  CachedFileRequest pendingRequest)
                                           throws FileRequestException,
                                                  java.io.IOException
        Description copied from class: SpriteCollection
        Double dispatch method. It should simply call return loader.finishLoading(set, this, spriteID, pendingRequest);
        Specified by:
        finishLoading in class SpriteCollection
        Parameters:
        loader - The SpriteLoader currently doing the loading work, needing some help finishing it.
        set - The SpriteSet the image is being loaded from
        spriteID - The ID of the sprite being loaded
        pendingRequest - The file request grabbing the sprite's data
        Returns:
        The requested image, once it is loaded and ready
        Throws:
        FileRequestException - If the sprite file data could not be read
        java.io.IOException - If the FileServer could not get the image files
